@aisuni you should cast the regularization losses to fp32 before calling tf.reduce_sum. E.g.:

                    loss = tf.reduce_sum([tf.reduce_mean(tf.cast(reg_loss, tf.float32))
                               for loss in losses],
                               name='reg_loss_mean_sum')

(Also, you should probably use tf.add_n() instead of tf.reduce_sum() in this case.)

I recommend reading this guide for more info, and asking on StackOverflow if you have more questions.
body:
@aisuni you should cast the regularization losses to fp32 before calling `tf.reduce_sum`. E.g.:

```python
                    loss = tf.reduce_sum([tf.reduce_mean(tf.cast(reg_loss, tf.float32))
                               for loss in losses],
                               name='reg_loss_mean_sum')
```
(Also, you should probably use `tf.add_n()` instead of `tf.reduce_sum()` in this case.)

I recommend reading [this guide](http://docs.nvidia.com/deeplearning/sdk/mixed-precision-training/index.html) for more info, and asking on StackOverflow if you have more questions.
